page.title: 02GWENNAP CHURCH
page.content: The Parish Church at Gwennap is dedicated to St.Wenappa - a Celtic Saint. The earliest{church}was founded in 500 A.D. but the present{building} dates from 1200 A.D. The Bell Tower is detached from the main church and is probably 15th.Century. The bells were hung in the 18th.Century and were probably paid for from the proceeds from the sale of the original stained glass windows. The granite pillars are the{second {highest}in Cornwall. There is a fine carved slate{memorial}to a mine agent carved by N.N.Burnard of Altarnun at the age of 15. The oldest slate memorial is to James Perrowe who died of smallpox in 1691. Legend has it that the church is haunted by the{ghost}of one of the earlier canons.
